origin_of_ch_char_book: (è²·, ä¹°, mai, buy) is a combination of a net (ç½‘, wang, net) and a seashell . A net is a useful tool for gathering things, and seashells mean money. Therefore, this signifies a scene where a person is purchasing something sold in a net and is paying with seashells. (åƒ¹, ä»·, jia, price) On the left is a man, on the right is a lid of a bowl filled with goods, and a seashell â€” which means money â€” below the character. People are selling and buying, haggling over the price.,(é›¢, ç¦», li, leave) is composed of a bird (é³¥, é¸Ÿ, niao, bird) and a snare (ç½‘, wang, net) which can catch the bird. Birds are very perceptive so they fly away quickly even at the slightest hint of someone approaching. Therefore, this Chinese character evoloved to mean â€œto departâ€ or â€œto leaveâ€.
humanum_full_description_en:
Inscriptions like a piece of unfolded net, the interlaced lines in the middle are like net lines. Bronze writing and Xiao Zhuan wrote a horizontal pen on the top of the net. Later, the " net " was added with the sound symbol " death " to become "ç½”", and the meaning symbol "ç³¸" was added to form a " net ", which means it is woven with silk rope. Now the simplified characters use " net ", which is a retro usage.

"Said Wen": "The net (Gang), tied the rope at the sacrifice, to fish. From Zhe, go down the elephant net to communicate. All the nets belong to the net. ğ¦‰¸ (ç½”), the net or die. ğ¦‹Ÿ (ç½‘), net or from ç³¸. ğ •ˆ (ğ •ƒ), Guwen net. ğ¦‰¯, Yiwen net.â€

Oracle is used as a verb to mean to set up a net to hunt, "Collection" 10514: "Net pheasant, only (get) eight." It means to catch a pheasant with a net and get eight. "Collection" 28329: "Net Deer".

Bronze inscriptions are used as names of people and clan.
humanum_short_description_en: A golden inscription is like an open net, and the middle is like a rope net intertwined. " Net " is the first article of " Net ". The original meaning is a net used to catch fish, shrimp or birds and animals.

network
Basic explanation of words
network
(network)
wÇng
A fishing and bird catching device made of ropes, threads, etc.: fishing nets. Snare. Open one side of the net (Yu treats it with a forgiving attitude). The net leaks and swallows the boat (Yu Fa decree is too wide to let the bad guys slip through the net).
Something shaped like a net: the electric grid. Hair net.
A crisscrossed organization or system like a net: dots. Communication network. All over the world.
Catch with a net: net to a big fish.
Shrouded like a net: red silk in the eyes.
